Third party services

Of course we are all for responsible disclosure, which you might have seen if you have read our blog. So here we have listed all the third party services we use in different ways in alphabetical order and an added a short comment on why or how we use them.

Adyen

For payments we use Adyen. You can read their terms and conditions on their website.

Amazon

We use various Amazon services in Ireland, including Amazon EC2, Amazon RDS, Amazon SES and Amazon S3 to provide Detectify to you.

Desk

Whenever you have a question for us. We will receive that question and answer it via desk. You find their privacy policy here and their terms of use here.

Disqus

We use disqus as the commenting service to our blog. So perhaps you want to read through their terms of service and privacy policy.

Effective TLDs

Used by registered-domain-libs. http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/netwerk/dns/effective_tld_names.dat

Google AdWords

We have google adwords tracking on the page to optimize our advertising within the network. You find their privacy policy here.

Google Analytics

We use Google Analytics to analyse the website traffic. To learn more about the Google analytics terms of service you can read here. You can read more about the privacy and about safeguarding your data here.

idna_convert

We use this to parse IDNA urls

/** * Encode/decode Internationalized Domain Names. * * The class allows to convert internationalized domain names * (see RFC 3490 for details) as they can be used with various registries worldwide * to be translated between their original (localized) form and their encoded form * as it will be used in the DNS (Domain Name System). * * The class provides two public methods, encode() and decode(), which do exactly * what you would expect them to do. You are allowed to use complete domain names, * simple strings and complete email addresses as well. That means, that you might * use any of the following notations: * * - www.nörgler.com * - xn--nrgler-wxa * - xn--brse-5qa.xn--knrz-1ra.info * * Unicode input might be given as either UTF-8 string, UCS-4 string or UCS-4 array. * Unicode output is available in the same formats. * You can select your preferred format via {@link set_paramter()}. * * ACE input and output is always expected to be ASCII. * * @author Matthias Sommerfeld <mso@phlylabs.de> * @copyright 2004-2011 phlyLabs Berlin, http://phlylabs.de * @version 0.8.0 2011-03-11 */

MalwareDomainList

We use malwaredomainlist.com’s list of infected domains to see if a scanned domain contains malware.

MySQL

For some of our temporary storage, we use a hardened version of MySQL.

Optimizely

For optimizing the service we use optimizely. To learn more about the privacy policy of Optimizely, click here, to learn more about their terms of use, click here, and to learn how to opt out of that service click here.

Registered-domain-libs

We use this to get filter invalid domain names.

ShareThis

If you would like to share anything from our blog using the share buttons and the end of each blog post. You find their privacy policy here and their terms of use here, there is also an opt up alternative in their privacy policy.

Site Dossier

We use sitedossier.com to find additional subdomains on scanned domains.

SpyEye Tracker

We use SpyEye Tracker to see if a scanned domain contains a Command & Control center for the SpyEye trojan.

Tumblr

Our blogs run on Tumblr, everything we write about can be found at blog.detectify.com and labs.detectify.com.

VirusTotal

We use VirusTotal to find viruses and malware hosted on scanned domains. Detectify is authorized for commercial use of VirusTotal.

ZeuS Tracker

We use ZeuS Tracker to see if a scanned domain contains a Command & Control center for the ZeuS trojan.

SmartThreadPool

This helps Detectify to perform parallel operations.
